column.name: therapy_type

column.description: What was the clinical effect of the therapy?
column.name: therapy_response

column.name: procedure_interval

column.description: Controlled vocabulary description of the procedure type. Vocabulary can be extended by disease-specific projects. Prefix extensions with 3-digit center code, e.g. 008.1 Beijing Cancer Hospital, fine needle aspiration of primary
column.name: procedure_type

column.description: Anatomical site of the procedure. This must use a standard controlled vocabulary which should be reported in advance to the DCC.
column.name: procedure_site

column.description: For resection procedures, an indication of the extent of residual disease.
column.name: resection_status

column.description: ID of ICGC specimen resulting from procedure. If present, must match specimen_id in specimen data file.

column.description: Gene(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl gene id. Separate multiple genes with vertical bars in the form of geneA|geneB|geneC. If no gene is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: gene_affected

column.description: Transcript(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts from the same gene with commas, and separate transcripts from different genes with vertical bars. eg. transcriptA1, transcriptA2|transcriptB1|transcriptC1,transcriptC2,transcriptC3. If no transcript is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: transcript_affected

column.description: Gene(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl gene id. Separate multiple genes with vertical bars in the form of geneA|geneB|geneC. If no gene is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: gene_affected

column.description: Transcript(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts from the same gene with commas, and separate transcripts from different genes with vertical bars. eg. transcriptA1, transcriptA2|transcriptB1|transcriptC1,transcriptC2,transcriptC3. column.description: Unique identfier for the analysis performed for a particular group of samples
column.name: analysis_id

column.description: Unique identifier for the control sample
column.name: control_sample_id

column.description: Unique identifier for the variation
column.name: variation_id

column.description: Functional consequence of the SNP. If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple consequences by commas. (#)
column.name: consequence_type

column.description: Changes at amino acid level. Indicate the reference aa, position and variation aa. If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple aa variation by commas.
column.name: aa_variation

column.description: Changes in coding sequence. Indicate position, reference base and variation base. If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple cds variation by commas.
column.name: cds_variation

column.description: Protein domain containing the mutation/variation. Use Pfam accession. If multiple transcripts are involved, separate multiple domains by commas.
column.name: protein_domain_affected

column.description: Gene(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl gene id. Separate multiple genes with vertical bars in the form of geneA|geneB|geneC. If no gene is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: gene_affected

column.description: Transcript(s) containing the mutation/variation. Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts from the same gene with commas, and separate transcripts from different genes with vertical bars. eg. transcriptA1, transcriptA2|transcriptB1|transcriptC1,transcriptC2,transcriptC3. If no transcript is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: transcript_affected

column.description: Version of Ensembl gene build used for annotation
column.name: gene_build_version

column.description: Optional field to leave notes
column.name: note

column.description: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider. It must be coded, and correspond to a donor ID listed in the donor data file.
column.name: donor_id

column.description: Unique identifier for the specimen assigned by data provider.
column.name: specimen_id

column.description: Controlled vocabulary description of specimen type.
column.name: specimen_type

column.description: Free text description of site of specimen if 'normal control (other)' or 'tumour (other)' was specified in specimen_type field.
column.name: specimen_type_other

column.description: Interval between primary diagnosis and specimen acquisition, in days
column.name: specimen_interval

column.description: Type of treatment the donor received prior to specimen acquisition.
column.name: specimen_donor_treatment_type

column.description: If 'other' therapy indicated in previous column, describe it here. eg: molecular
column.name: specimen_donor_treatment_type_other

column.description: Description of technique used to process specimen
column.name: specimen_processing

column.description: If 'other' specified for specimen_processing, may indicate technique here.
column.name: specimen_processing_other

column.description: Description of how specimen was stored. For specimens that were extracted freshly or immediately cultured, answer (1) 'NA'.
column.name: specimen_storage

column.description: If 'other' specified for specimen_storage, may indicate technique here.
column.name: specimen_storage_other

column.description: Whether tumour was confirmed in the specimen by histological examination.
column.name: tumour_confirmed

column.description: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank name here
column.name: specimen_biobank

column.description: If the specimen was obtained from a biobank, provide the biobank accession number here.
column.name: specimen_biobank_id

column.description: Whether additional tissue is available for followup studies.
column.name: specimen_available

column.description: 'WHO International Histological Classification of Tumours' code
column.name: tumour_histological_type

column.description: Name of tumour grading system
column.name: tumour_grading_system

column.description: Tumour grade using indicated grading system
column.name: tumour_grade

column.description: Optional additional grading provided as a comma-delimited list of 'grading system:grade'
column.name: tumour_grade_supplemental

column.description: Name of tumour staging system used
column.name: tumour_stage_system

column.description: Pathological tumour stage value using indicated staging system
column.name: tumour_stage

column.description: Optional additional staging provided as a comma-delimited list of 'staging system:stage'
column.name: tumour_stage_supplemental

column.description: Linkout(s) to digital image of a stained section, demonstrating a representative section of tumour
column.name: digital_image_of_stained_section

column.description: Free text notes allowed
column.name: specimen_notes

column.description: Unique identifier for the donor; assigned by data provider.
column.name: donor_id

column.description: Donor biological sex. 'Other' has been removed from the controlled vocabulary due to identifiability concerns.
column.name: donor_sex

column.description: Country, and optionally state or province code, but not city.
column.name: donor_region_of_residence

column.description: Donor's last known vital status
column.name: donor_vital_status

column.description: Donor's last known disease status.
column.name: disease_status_last_followup

column.description: Type of relapse or progression (for liquid tumours), if applicable
column.name: donor_relapse_type

column.description: Age at primary diagnosis.
column.name: donor_age_at_diagnosis

column.description: Age at which first specimen was collected.
column.name: donor_age_at_enrollment

column.description: Age at last followup
column.name: donor_age_at_last_followup

column.description: If donor was clinically disease free following primary therapy and relapse or progression (for liquid tumours) occurred, length of disease free interval, in days.
column.name: donor_relapse_interval

column.description: ICD-10 diagnostic code
column.name: donor_diagnosis_icd10

column.description: Clinical staging system used at time of diagnosis, if determined. Note that this is supplementary to specimen's pathological staging.
column.name: donor_tumour_staging_system_at_diagnosis

column.description: Stage at diagnosis using indicated staging system. Note that this is supplementary to specimen's pathological staging.
column.name: donor_tumour_stage_at_diagnosis

column.description: Optional additional staging provided as a comma-delimited list of 'staging system:stage'
column.name: donor_tumour_stage_at_diagnosis_supplemental

column.description: How long has donor survived since primary diagnosis, in days. If source data was collected in months, use a multiplier value of '30.44' to convert value to days when preparing submission.
column.name: donor_survival_time

column.description: Interval from primary diagnosis to last followup date. ICGC requests that patients be followed up every 6 months while alive.
column.name: donor_interval_of_last_followup

column.description: Free text notes concerning donor
column.name: donor_notes

column.description: Raw count of sequencing reads if analyzed by sequencing platforms

column.description: Normalized value of expression level if analyzed by microarray platforms

column.name: tumour_sample_id

column.description: Unique variant id (institute wide). One id per single event
column.name: sv_id

column.description: Ordering of breakpoint pairs within a single structural mutation/variation event
column.name: placement

column.description: Annotation describing sequence mutation/variation based on breakpoint pairs
column.name: annotation

column.description: HGVS nomenclature for description of sequence mutation/variation. E.g. chr3:g.1234567-2345678inv.
column.name: interpreted_annotation

column.description: Type of mutation/variation
column.name: variant_type

column.description: Name of the donor chromosome containing the mutation/variation
column.name: chr_from

column.description: Breakpoint position of the mutation/variation on the donor chromosome
column.name: chr_from_bkpt

column.description: Donor chromome strand
column.name: chr_from_strand

column.description: Number of bases around chr_from_bkpt that may contain the real breakpoint
column.name: chr_from_range

column.description: Flanking sequences that are 200bp upstream and 200bp downstream to the chr_from_bkpt position.
column.name: chr_from_flanking_seq

column.description: Name of the acceptor chromosome containing the mutation/variation
column.name: chr_to

column.description: Breakpoint position of the mutation/variation on the acceptor chromosome
column.name: chr_to_bkpt

column.description: Acceptor chromome strand
column.name: chr_to_strand

column.description: Number of bases around chr_to_bkpt that may contain the real breakpoint
column.name: chr_to_range

column.description: Flanking sequences that are 200bp upstream and 200bp downstream to the chr_to_bkpt position.
column.name: chr_to_flanking_seq

column.description: If a microhomology is inserted, provide sequence
column.name: microhomology_sequence

column.description: If non-templated DNA is inserted, provide sequence
column.name: non_templated_sequence

column.description: Evidence supporting a structural mutation/variation
column.name: evidence

column.description: Quality score for the mutation/variation call
column.name: quality_score

column.description: Probability of the mutation/variation call
column.name: probability

column.description: Indicate if the mutation/variation has been validated
column.name: validation_status

column.name: validation_platform

column.description: Value code of cross-reference database:ID of the mutation in the cross-reference database. Separate multiple entries by commas.
column.name: db_xref

column.description: Optional field to leave notes
column.name: note

column.description: Gene(s) affected by the breakpoints. Use Ensembl gene id. Separate multiple genes with vertical bars in the form of geneA|geneB|geneC. If both breakpoints affect genes, then use | to separate them. If no gene is affected, use -888 (not applicable).
column.name: gene_affected

column.description: Transcript(s) affected by the breakpoints. Use Ensembl transcript id. Separate multiple transcripts from the same gene with commas, and separate transcripts from different genes with vertical bars. eg. transcriptA1, transcriptA2|transcriptB1|transcriptC1
column.name: transcript_affected

column.description: author list involed in the study

column.description: Name of the journal study was published
column.name: journal

column.description: volume number for the published paper

column.description: Issue number for the published paper
column.name: issue

column.description: start and end page numbers, i.e. 1224-1237
column.name: page_numbers

column.name: date

column.description: Unique identfier for the analysis performed for a particular group of samples
column.name: analysis_id

column.description: Unique identifier for the sample being analyzed
column.name: sample_id

column.description: For known exons, use exonID1_exonID2 where exonID1 and exonID2 are Ensembl IDs of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively. For novel or putative exons, use assemblyBuild_exon1chr_exon1end_exon2chr_exon2start where assemblyBuild is hg18 or hg19; exon1chr and exone2chr are the chromosomes of the 5' and 3' exons, respectively; exon1end is the end position of the 5'exon; exon2start is the start position of the 3'exon.
column.name: junction_id

column.description: Stable ID of the gene containing the 5' exon at the junction. For annotated gene, use Ensembl gene ID. For putative and novel gene, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.
column.name: gene_stable_id

column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the above gene.
column.name: gene_chromosome

column.description: Strand of the chromosome
column.name: gene_strand

column.description: Start position of the entire gene on the chromosome as annotated in Ensembl
column.name: gene_start

column.description: End position of the entire gene on the chromosome as annotated in Ensembl
column.name: gene_end

column.description: In the case of a fusion gene, provide the Stable ID of the gene containing the 3' exon at the junction. For annotated genes, use Ensembl gene ID. For putative and novel genes, use assemblyBuild_chr_start_end where assemblyBuild can be hg18 or hg19.
column.name: second_gene_stable_id

column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the 5' exon (#)
column.name: exon1_chromosome

column.description: Number of bases from 5' exon
column.name: exon1_number_bases

column.description: End position of the 5' exon on the chromosome
column.name: exon1_end

column.description: Chromsome strand of the 5' exon
column.name: exon1_strand

column.description: Name of the chromosome containing the 3' exon (#)
column.name: exon2_chromosome

column.description: Number of bases from 3' exon
column.name: exon2_number_bases

column.description: Start position of the 3' exon on the chromosome
column.name: exon2_start

column.description: Chromsome strand of the 3' exon
column.name: exon2_strand

column.description: Indicate if the function is the result of a fusion gene
column.name: is_fusion_gene

column.description: Indicate if the splice form is novel
column.name: is_novel_splice_form

column.description: Provide junction sequence if either is_fusion_gene or is_novel_splice_form is true
column.name: junction_seq

column.description: Type of junction
column.name: junction_type

column.description: Count of sequencing reads that span across exons
column.name: junction_read_count

column.description: Quality score for the junction call
column.name: quality_score

column.description: Probability of the junction call
column.name: probability

column.description: Indicate if the junction has been validated
column.name: validation_status

column.description: Platform or technology used in validation
column.name: validation_platform

column.description: Optional field to leave notes
column.name: note
